title: Speeches about Great Britain
main_text:
If you have a important point to make, donâ€™t try to be subtle or clever. Use a pile driver. Hit the point once. Then come back and hit it again. Then hit it a third time - a tremendous whack. Winston Churchill

'Freedom or Death' by Emmeline Pankhurst

'Professions for Women' by Virginia Woolf

'A Room of One's Own - Shakespeare's Sister' by Virginia Woolf

'Wind of Change' by Harold MacMillan

'Weapons for squalid and trivial ends' by Aneurin Bevan

'The lady's not for turning' by Margaret Thatcher

'We Shall Fight on the Beaches' by Winston Churchill
